values: I found mispelling occurs (in Alla/KI combined) 10 times as much I saw/did the same thing in my English subject for 17 years of education. What I mean by mispell is really a mispell, not a typo. Save -> saev is a typo. Raise -> riase is a typo. Typo is usually forgivable. Some people (like me) can type very fast so that they swap some words by neighboring keys. Compare -> compair is a mispell. Complain -> complaint is a mispell. Then <-> than is a mispell. Your <-> you're is horrible mispell. I want to say "Go kill yourself, if your main language is English", but that's too cruel. My perspective seeing how people write written English has changed for past 2-3 years. What this "bad habit" lead to? mispelling absorbed word from other language. How do I spell Seigan? I still remembered my Korean friend complained how hard English is because there is no consistency pronouncing two different words using the same vowel: "Car" and "Bad" Not to say I'm a spelling NAZI or something... I sometimes do intended mispell/typo to make my sentence funny. So, if one day you find I write English in wrong spelling. That's an intended error and you have no right to complain :P

yeah... so I returned yesterday... just trying to get some GS GP earlier.. so I can get everything done by the end of this month.... luckily, Yunii still invite me for newly added TM mission. So, thanks a lot guys. I really appriciate your offer ^^ It's really rare people invite me for fun thing We pretty much start TM8 (mercenary life) until the Royal Puppeteer part. We got all the Jody's Acid for popping the fomor NM in Caedarva Mire (access through Nashmau). So we did it this evening Popping the NM Good fomor Elvaan... you look kinda cool there After we got the key item, we went back to Naja, and now porting to Dvucca Isle stagging point. Zoning to Arrapago Reef, we take the CS on the ship deck (around the center of the map) I like this yagudo, he's so cool The battle goes like this: our strategy: have a kiter(yunii, BRD), some kiter healer(Azzam and Anomaly (2 BLM)), and 2 DDer, (me and Ayasha(WAR)), and a DDer healer(Aruni (SMN), but she concentrate too much on yunii) first round is 5 fomors. they hit pretty weak (about 30 damage... even lower than easy prey ochu in Wajoam) Think like it's CoP6-4 BC mamet stage. They are squishy squishy. But annoying as hell since they have absorb TP move second round... now we got 5 more fomors + COR fomor captain. The objective is to have the fomor COR HP to 20% his defense is not as squishy as his underlings' I can say it's pretty much a high IT level for 75. That slug shot took about only 11% of its HP and I think we underestimated this BC too much by zerg rush and low cure on DDer Vulcan Shot is like Barrage... see how much damage it does and I'm dead within 3 rounds of attack see you tomorrow bish. I'll be back (hopefully... if I'm done with paper) no auto kick-out from the BC. we didn't have any RR up, so we have to HP :( bye bye exp... good 5k exp gone from the first 2 days lol

rated by the order of interest:
  • Stealth Shot
    • seems cool... -10 enmity can be very helpful, If barrage "bug" is left as is now, probably we can see Stealth Shot + WS -> Barrage (no hate) -> PPA + WS
  • Flashy Shot
    • Very useful... but 20 minutes init recast time make me cry... If they make it 15 minutes, I probably, without doubt, placing 15 points on this category
  • Recycle
    • Saving money is good, but it's not neccessary :P
  • Snapshot
    • 35~55 less delay won't give you any marginal improvment in exp and probably HNM too, not to mention if you reduce your delay below 530, the TP gained droped drastically Probably I'm going 1 or 2 stealth and 3 flashy, or 3 snapshot (if the delay reduce is 5% per merit)

somehow... support job has become the 'must job' in endgame...

"if we got no BRD, then we don't go PT"
funny... but truth :( *learn to accept it*

Monk
hit fast, decent damage... but probably not much thing you can do for performance optimization

Thief
hit fast, possible spike damage every minute, can solo... interesting, but I don't like the low number on normal hit

Warrior
decent-high damage, wide range of offensive and defensive skill, gear, and abilities. good all round. but same thing with MNK.. not much to do to for performance optimization

Beast Master
the best solo job on wild. probably the potent highest DD in PT w/ pet. 1st option for soloable job

Dark Knight
best melee spike damage. accuracy can be acquired by some good endgame gear. but it just hard to get all the adaman...

Dragoon
uh... no comment. I haven't PTed with them since 50. same reason again with "not much you can do to improve performance"

Ninja
similar to war. solo can be kinda tricky. but ugh... can be more expensive than rng

Ranger
my favourite job. Plus since the update, getting quick TP is really tricky

Samurai
probably my 2nd favourite. Because you need skill on timing the TP gain. damage probably average on per hit and WS.. but heck, I'm really impressed by SAM/NIN WS spamage on deco weapon PT.

Blue Mage
no comment... I haven't killed a single creature with this job. I heard it's really good for soloing up to mid 30.

Puppetmaster
people say sux... I have no comment. never got any of them in PT

Corsair
best XP job for experience++, but again, this is hybrid job. Unlike PLD which is not a hybrid of WAR and WHM, COR have noticably less attack and accuracy on ranged attack as well as lower performance (on average) compared to BRD. (and lol to 0 damage on god)

I tried to calculate accuracy from WAR/NIN and RNG/NIN (both hume)

WAR/NIN: 68 DEX = 34 accuracy
269 Axe = 200+62.1 = 262 accuracy
gear :
Head : Optical hat = 10 accuracy
Earrings : 2x Assault earring = 4 accuracy
Body : Adaman Hauberk = 10 DEX 15 accuracy = 20 accuracy
Hand : Adaman Muffler = 4 accuracy
Legs : Adaman Breeches = 6 accuracy
Feet : Adaman sollerets = 3 accuracy
total gear 1 = 47 accuracy

extra : life belt = 10 accuracy
total gear 2 = 57 accuracy

*(I believe no WAR use sniper's on endgame xp huh?)*

overall total w/o food = 343~353 accuracy
overall total w/ food = 394~405 accuracy

RNG/NIN : 
Melee:
66 DEX
240 Axe = 200 + 36 accuracy = 236 accuracy
Accuracy bonus I~IV = 48 accuracy
Gear :
optical hat : 10 accuracy
rajas ring: 2.5 accuracy
merman's ring : -10 accuracy
total : 319 accuracy
(OK this is kinda crap, I know RNG is not designed for melee)

ranged :
269 marksmanship/archery = 200 + 62.1 = 262 ranged accuracy
AGI : 74 +15(Seiryu's kote) +4(RK belt+2, Hawker's knife) = 93/2 = 46 ranged accuracy
Accuracy bonus I~IV = 48 ranged accuracy
gear:
Main : Fransisca = 7 ranged accuracy
Sub : Hawker's knife = 12 ranged accuracy
Neck : Ranger's neckalce = 5 ranged accuracy
Body : Hunter's Jerkin = 10 ranged accuracy
Hands : Seiryu Kote = 10 ranged accuracy
Ring : Merman's Ring 10 ranged accuracy
Legs : Pahluwan Seraweels = 4 ranged accuracy
Total gear 1 : 58 racc

extra:
optical hat: 10 ranged accuracy
2nd racc ring : 10 ranged accuracy
bow + arrow = 7~10 ranged accuracy
Total gear 2 : 88 ranged accuracy

total overall : 414 ~ 434 ranged accuracy

If my accuracy is caped at 85%, then I have right to say ranged accuracy is broken

From my post on Alla Feedback and Suggestion Forum I think it's not the RNG only problem. I believe people perspective on DD is now concentrated on NIN,WAR,and MNK mostly. Let's see what make them seems strong. NIN : - sub /WAR for attack up on berserk - Sub /WAR for double attack - high evasion and parrying along with utsusemi for very high survavibility. - dual weild trait easily make them one of the fastest TP gain along with wide range haste+ gear WAR : - berserk, agressor : 3 minutes attack and accuracy up. compared to RNG sharpshot.. they're much superior (although we don't know what's the +accuracy sharpshot was/is) - utsusemi /NIN for survivability MNK : - focus : 2 minutes accuracy up with similar number of aggressor's - boost : similar to berserk with slightly lower attack boost - subing /WAR for berserk complementing the boost - subing /WAR for double attack, complementing the kick attack. This make them one of the top TP gainer - Martial arts trait which work really really nice on 75 - very high survivability with high HP and Chakra Basically, there are 4 commons strong points of which those jobs shared: - good atk+ up ability - good acc+ up ability - quick TP gain - high survivability Let's see the other other jobs: I think I can make 2 categories of unpopular job: 1. Unpopular job but still have their own strong point: THF : - Pretty quick TP gainer, and SATA+WS makes very good spike damage - No acc+ and atk+ traits/abilities - Quick TP gain from triple attack - many haste+ gear available for TP gain SAM : - Master of TP. very useful in the fight where you rely heavily on skillchain. And there are a lot of fight in endgame needing Skillchain-Magic Burst. - can sub /WAR for double attack, enhancing their TP gain - can sub /THF for SATA+WS, making their spike damage higher 2. Unpopular job with very low quality traits/ability or low identity DRK : - actually a good DD. Master of Atk. Equip wise, they are the same as Warrior. They are much better in atk+ trait/ ability, but don't have any natural acc+ trait/ability - can sub /WAR for double attack, enhancing their TP gain - can sub /THF for SATA+WS, making their spike damage higher DRG : - high soloability - little acc+ and atk+ trait - can sub /WAR for double attack, enhancing their TP gain - can sub /THF for SATA+WS, making their spike damage higher - Is there any fight where jumps are highly essential? make such battle exist! RNG : - Master of accuracy. But seeing the ranged accuracy performance right now... I can say it's ironic - can sub /WAR for atk+ up, BUT low HP and defense make their survivability very low - can sub /NIN for higher survivability after Sidewinder/ Slug Shot, but no atk+ trait/ability at all. This forces ranger to eat attack food for acceptable damage. But given the ranged accuracy is broken, what can they expect? - subing /WAR gives no benefit in double attack since almost no RNG go melee-heavy right now - very essential at kited mob fight. BUT what are the mobs that (highly) need to be kited in the game? King Behemoth, Chlevnik, and Kirin. That are the only 3 as far as I can think The bold part is the important part... they should've reconsider balancing them through all the job
